turns.speaker: SCHINDLER
turns.text: You try to be fair to people, they walk out the door;  I've never understood that.  What's next?

turns.speaker: STERN
turns.text: Christmas presents.

turns.speaker: SCHINDLER
turns.text: Ah, yes.

turns.speaker: SCHINDLER
turns.text: This, I don't know, maybe you can trade it for something.

turns.speaker: STERN
turns.text: Thank you.

turns.speaker: SCHINDLER
turns.text: I got to go, I'll see you.

turns.speaker: STERN
turns.text: Oskar -

turns.speaker: SCHINDLER
turns.text: You think I don't know what you're doing? You're so quiet all the time?  I know.

turns.speaker: STERN
turns.text: Are you losing money?

turns.speaker: SCHINDLER
turns.text: No, I'm not losing money, that's not the point.

turns.speaker: STERN
turns.text: What other point is -

turns.speaker: SCHINDLER
turns.text: It's dangerous.  It's dangerous, to me, personally.

turns.speaker: SCHINDLER
turns.text: You have to understand, Goeth's under enormous pressure.  You have to think of it in his situation.  He's got this whole place to run, he's responsible for everything that goes on here, all these people - he's got a lot of things to worry about.  And he's got the war. Which brings out the worst in people.  Never the good, always the bad.  Always the bad. But in normal circumstances, he wouldn't be like this.  He'd be all right.  There'd be just the good aspects of him.  Which is a wonderful crook.  A guy who loves good food, good wine, the ladies, making money...

turns.speaker: STERN
turns.text: And killing.

turns.speaker: SCHINDLER
turns.text: I'll admit it's a weakness.  I don't think he enjoys it.  All right, he does enjoy it, so what? What do you expect me to do about it?

turns.speaker: STERN
turns.text: There's nothing you can do.  I'm not asking you to do anything.  You came into my office.

turns.speaker: SCHINDLER
turns.text: I'll talk to him.

turns.speaker: STERN
turns.text: I think it's too late.

turns.speaker: SCHINDLER
turns.text: Well, I'll talk to somebody.  I'll take care of it.

turns.speaker: STERN
turns.text: Four hundred, four fifty -

turns.speaker: SCHINDLER
turns.text: More.

turns.speaker: STERN
turns.text: Eight hundred, give or take.

turns.speaker: SCHINDLER
turns.text: Give or take what, Stern - how many - count them.

turns.speaker: STERN
turns.text: That's very generous of you.

turns.speaker: SCHINDLER
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: STERN
turns.text: We need to talk.

turns.speaker: SCHINDLER
turns.text: Stern.

turns.speaker: STERN
turns.text: They arrived.

turns.speaker: SCHINDLER
turns.text: They arrived, can you believe it?

turns.speaker: SCHINDLER
turns.text: Well, that's to be expected.  They have to understand.  These are start-up problems. This isn't pots and pans, this is a precise business.  I'll write them a letter.

turns.speaker: STERN
turns.text: They're withholding payment.

turns.speaker: SCHINDLER
turns.text: Well, sure.  So would I.  So would you. I wouldn't worry about it.  We'll get it right one of these days.

turns.speaker: STERN
turns.text: There's a rumor you've been going around miscalibrating the machines.  I don't think that's a good idea.

turns.speaker: SCHINDLER
turns.text: No?

turns.speaker: STERN
turns.text: I know what you're saying, but I don't see the difference.

turns.speaker: SCHINDLER
turns.text: You don't?  I do.  I see a difference.

turns.speaker: STERN
turns.text: You'll lose money.

turns.speaker: STERN
turns.text: I'll talk to you later.

turns.speaker: SCHINDLER
turns.text: No, no, what, what is it?

turns.speaker: SCHINDLER
turns.text: I could've got more ... if I'd just ... I don't know, if I'd just ... I could've got more...

turns.speaker: STERN
turns.text: Oskar, there are twelve hundred people who are alive because of you.  Look at them.

turns.speaker: SCHINDLER
turns.text: If I'd made more money ...I threw away so much money, you have no idea. If I'd just ...

turns.speaker: STERN
turns.text: There will be generations because of what you did.

turns.speaker: SCHINDLER
turns.text: I didn't do enough.

turns.speaker: STERN
turns.text: You did so much.

turns.speaker: TOFFEL
turns.text: It's got nothing to do with reality, Oskar, I know it and you know it, it's a matter of national priority to these guys.  It's got a ritual significance to them, Jews shoveling snow.

turns.speaker: SCHINDLER
turns.text: I lost a day of production.  I lost a worker.  I expect to be compensated.

turns.speaker: TOFFEL
turns.text: File a grievance with the Economic Office, it's your right.

turns.speaker: SCHINDLER
turns.text: Would it do any good?

turns.speaker: TOFFEL
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: TOFFEL
turns.text: A one-armed machinist, Oskar?

turns.speaker: SCHINDLER
turns.text: He was a metal press operator, quite skilled.

turns.speaker: SCHINDLER
turns.text: What's he done that's so bad - take money? That's a crime?  Come on, what are we here for, to fight a war?  We're here to make money, all of us.

turns.speaker: TOFFEL
turns.text: There's taking money and there's taking money, you know that.  He's taking money.

turns.speaker: TOFFEL
turns.text: He's stealing from you, Oskar.

turns.speaker: SCHINDLER
turns.text: Of course he's stealing from me, we're in business together.  What is this?  I'm sitting here, suddenly everybody's talking like this is something bad.  We take from each other, we take from the Army, everybody uses everybody, it works out, everybody's happy.

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN TYLER
turns.text: We know that, son.

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: The killer was trying to get to her. That sorority girl was a distraction.

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN TYLER
turns.text: We're aware of that.

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: I can do it, Captain.

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN TYLER
turns.text: Thanks, Dewey, but I was thinking I'd pull Jesse off...

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: How's the name search going?

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN TYLER
turns.text: 37 usages of Himbry  located in the registar's office. 9 Tatum's, 47 Riley's. And that's just on campus. It's hopeless.

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: Can't we hold him?

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN TYLER
turns.text: No, we got pressure from California State. The man practically has clemency. We can't run the risk of falsely accusing him. He has to be standing over the victim with knife in hand before we make a move.

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: What now?

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN TYLER
turns.text: We're going to bring her in. Hide her out for a coupla days. And we're issuing a campus lock-in this evening. No one is allowed out after dark.

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: That doesn't work, sir.

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN TYLER
turns.text: Have you checked the...

turns.speaker: SHERIFF
turns.text: Attic, garage, basement, nothing.

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN TYLER
turns.text: Take the neighborhood.

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN TYLER
turns.text: We don't know if it's random. We haven't been able to connect the victims.

turns.speaker: SHERIFF
turns.text: The first two were stabbed without thought. The sorority girl was gutted with autopsy precision.

turns.speaker: SHERIFF
turns.text: Jesus Christ. Captain Tyler flies out of his seat and into action.

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN TYLER
turns.text: Find me every variation of Himbry and what was the other name...

turns.speaker: SHERIFF
turns.text: He's broken his pattern.

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN TYLER
turns.text: They've broken their pattern.

turns.speaker: SHERIFF
turns.text: You're sure about this two person thing?

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN TYLER
turns.text: Broad daylight, a crowded movie theatre. This is too much fun for one person.

turns.speaker: SHERIFF
turns.text: I would say we are now officially baffled.

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN TYLER
turns.text: On national television.

turns.speaker: CICI
turns.text: No, they broke up again. Bailey won't stop drinking and Sarah can't take it anymore.

turns.speaker: GIRL ON PHONE
turns.text: thought he was doing AA.

turns.speaker: CICI
turns.text: No, he quit - the whole God thing--he has issues. The previews for next week...

turns.speaker: GIRL ON PHONE
turns.text: That shit. He only calls you when he's drunk. Don't go over there.

turns.speaker: CICI
turns.text: I won't.

turns.speaker: GIRL ON PHONE
turns.text: Don't. Think Bailey.

turns.speaker: CICI
turns.text: Alright, alright...I'll call you back.

turns.speaker: CICI
turns.text: No, some creep asshole trying to scare me.

turns.speaker: GIRL ON PHONE
turns.text: It's hell week. Chill. The movie murders have brought out the crazies. It's nothing.

turns.speaker: CICI
turns.text: Shit.

turns.speaker: GIRL ON PHONE
turns.text: What is it?

turns.speaker: CICI
turns.text: I heard a noise.

turns.speaker: GIRL ON PHONE
turns.text: Where?

turns.speaker: GIRL ON PHONE
turns.text: Kill, kill, kill, kill, hah, hah, hah, hah...

turns.speaker: CICI
turns.text: Stop it...

turns.speaker: GIRL ON PHONE
turns.text: I can't believe you're alone in that house.

turns.speaker: CICI
turns.text: Outside.

turns.speaker: GIRL ON PHONE
turns.text: That's smart.

turns.speaker: GIRL ON PHONE
turns.text: Don't do that. Hang up...call...

turns.speaker: CICI
turns.text: What? I can't hear you...

turns.speaker: GIRL ON PHONE
turns.text: Hang up...call...

turns.speaker: CICI
turns.text: I'm losing you.

turns.speaker: GIRL ON PHONE
turns.text: ...campus security...send someone...check out...place...

turns.speaker: CICI
turns.text: Okay, okay. I'll call now. I'll call you back.

turns.speaker: CICI
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: MAN'S VOICE
turns.text: Who is this?

turns.speaker: CICI
turns.text: Cici. Who's this?

turns.speaker: MAN'S VOICE
turns.text: Someone who wants to talk to you.

turns.speaker: CICI
turns.text: Ted? Where are you? Are you drinking? Hold on.

turns.speaker: CICI
turns.text: Oh, I'm sorry. My bad.  I thought you were someone else.

turns.speaker: MAN'S VOICE
turns.text: That's okay.

turns.speaker: CICI
turns.text: Who do you want to speak with? Nobody's here.

turns.speaker: MAN'S VOICE
turns.text: Where is everybody?

turns.speaker: CICI
turns.text: We're co-sponsoring the Acid Rain mixer at the Sig Ep. house tonight.

turns.speaker: MAN'S VOICE
turns.text: Why aren't you there?

turns.speaker: CICI
turns.text: I'm designated driver. I have to be here in case a sister calls and needs a ride.

turns.speaker: MAN'S VOICE
turns.text: That's too bad.

turns.speaker: CICI
turns.text: "Drink with your brain." That's our motto. Who are you calling for?

turns.speaker: MAN'S VOICE
turns.text: What if I said you?

turns.speaker: CICI
turns.text: What if I said goodbye?

turns.speaker: MAN'S VOICE
turns.text: Why would you wanna do that?

turns.speaker: CICI
turns.text: Why do you always answer a question with a question?

turns.speaker: MAN'S VOICE
turns.text: I'm inquisitive.

turns.speaker: CICI
turns.text: I'm impatient. Look, do you wanna leave a message for someone?

turns.speaker: CICI
turns.text: Hello? Ted?

turns.speaker: MAN'S VOICE
turns.text: No, it's me.

turns.speaker: CICI
turns.text: WHAAAATT?

turns.speaker: MAN'S VOICE
turns.text: Don't forget to set the alarm.

turns.speaker: CICI
turns.text: Jesus, you scared me. What are you doing here?

turns.speaker: DAWNIE
turns.text: I live here.

turns.speaker: CICI
turns.text: I thought you were going to the mixer?

turns.speaker: DAWNIE
turns.text: I had to change. Did anyone call?

turns.speaker: CICI
turns.text: Just some asshole trying to scare me.

turns.speaker: DAWNIE
turns.text: Tina, it's Dawnie. I'm  on my way. Cici follows her back into the living room.

turns.speaker: CICI
turns.text: I'll go. I don't mind. Really.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Cotton.

turns.speaker: COTTON
turns.text: Can we talk?

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: I don't think that's a good idea.

turns.speaker: COTTON
turns.text: Look, yesterday wasn't my idea. That was all Gale and dollar signs and ratings.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: What do you want from me, Cotton?

turns.speaker: COTTON
turns.text: You could start with an apology.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: I did that.

turns.speaker: COTTON
turns.text: You wrote me a letter. Very cordial. Very appropriate.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: How? What could I say that would make a difference? I took away a year of your life--how do I apologize for that?

turns.speaker: COTTON
turns.text: I wish it was just a year. I lost everything because of you. I have nothing now. Look at me, this is what I've become. A long silence. Sidney is hanging on by threads.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Cotton, there isn't one day, one hour, one minute when I'm not reminded of what I've done. I have not had one second of reprieve and no therapy or religion or spiritual plane can ever erase what I feel in every vein of my being. And I wish I had in me what you need to hear but I don't think the words exist.

turns.speaker: COTTON
turns.text: I just thought if I saw you face to face, maybe it would help.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Did it?

turns.speaker: COTTON
turns.text: It helped me realize one thing.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: COTTON
turns.text: You're a self-obsessed little cunt like your mother.

turns.speaker: COTTON
turns.text: Its perfect, Sidney. No one will ever suspect me. I have proof. Im the victim.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Please, Cotton, dont do this.

turns.speaker: COTTON
turns.text: I get my revenge and make some fast cash.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Its over, Cotton.

turns.speaker: COTTON
turns.text: Not until youre dead.

turns.speaker: COTTON
turns.text: You know the story, Gale. Man falsely accused, sent to prison, proved innocent, released back into the real world and never trusted again. Want the exclusive?

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: Did you do it?

turns.speaker: COTTON
turns.text: Now, Gale, you were so instrumental in my freedom. You're not having character doubts now, are you?

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: You have a right to be angry.

turns.speaker: COTTON
turns.text: No, Gale, I don't have any rights. You made sure of that.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: Cotton, I've done nothing but help you.

turns.speaker: COTTON
turns.text: You've done nothing but get rich off of me. How many books have you sold, Gale? You think I don't understand points and royalties and ancilliary rights?

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: Don't do anything stupid, Cotton. You've come to far.

turns.speaker: COTTON
turns.text: Gale, I don't know what I'm doing from one moment to the next. I'm just taking it as it comes.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: Look, I'm sorry about the face.

turns.speaker: DEBBIE SALT
turns.text: Job hazard. Debbie Salt, stringer-- NEWSWEEK. Answer a few questions?

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: Fair enough.

turns.speaker: DEBBIE SALT
turns.text: What are you doing here? I thought you had retired from field reporting?

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: Well, you know I'm dear to the subject matter.

turns.speaker: DEBBIE SALT
turns.text: And much richer as a result.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: Do I know you? You look familiar.

turns.speaker: DEBBIE SALT
turns.text: I took your vulture seminar seminar at Berkeley last year.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: Good for you.

turns.speaker: DEBBIE SALT
turns.text: Hi, Gale, any leads?

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: Tons and tons.

turns.speaker: DEBBIE SALT
turns.text: Where is Sidney's father?

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: Home--where he lives.

turns.speaker: DEBBIE SALT
turns.text: And are the police sure about that?

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: Why don't you ask them?

turns.speaker: DEBBIE SALT
turns.text: Already did. He's the perfect suspect, don't you think?

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: No, I don't.

turns.speaker: DEBBIE SALT
turns.text: Parents are always responsible. It all starts in the home.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: Look, I know you kinda hold me up as your career template and it gives you some anal charge to challenge me but you win. Okay? I'm not interested in the scoop anymore. Excuse me.

turns.speaker: DEBBIE SALT
turns.text: I couldnt believe you didnt recognize me. You even interviewed me for your book.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: Youre all in this together?

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: Jesus, youre just as whacked as your son.

turns.speaker: DEBBIE SALT
turns.text: Where do you think he got it? Mental illness is heriditary. Who do you think incouraged him to kill your mother? He was a smart kid but children need parental guidance.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: What are you going to do?

turns.speaker: DEBBIE SALT
turns.text: Finish what my son started.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: But youll never get away with it.

turns.speaker: DEBBIE SALT
turns.text: Enter Cotton Weary.

turns.speaker: DEREK
turns.text: How do you put up with this Greek shit?

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Hey, it's cool. Hallie's into it, I'm into Hallie...

turns.speaker: DEREK
turns.text: My documentary is due on Tuesday.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: What's your subject?

turns.speaker: DEREK
turns.text: I WAS A SORORITY SLUT.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: I could use some therapy.

turns.speaker: DEREK
turns.text: Should we be worried about this guy? Isn't it kinda weird he just showed up and now people are dying?

turns.speaker: DEREK
turns.text: I think he's doing Dolly.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: "And I hope life treats you kind and I hope you have all you dreamed of offffff. I wish you JOYYY."

turns.speaker: DEREK
turns.text: Definitely Whitney.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Are they aware of your not so positive portrayal of Greek life?

turns.speaker: DEREK
turns.text: Not one bit.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Where's Sid?

turns.speaker: DEREK
turns.text: She dumped me.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: No way.

turns.speaker: DEREK
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: You freakin?

turns.speaker: DEREK
turns.text: How are you? You weren't in class. I called as soon as I heard...

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: I skipped. Too many "That's her" looks.

turns.speaker: DEREK
turns.text: I'm sorry, baby. What can I do'?

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Don't ask what you can do. No coddling. Life rolls on status quo.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: It's okay. I can peddle toilet paper.

turns.speaker: DEREK
turns.text: Sid, you don't have to.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Where have you been'? You missed my shining moment. I won the macaroni sundae binge.

turns.speaker: DEREK
turns.text: I'm sorry honey. I got behind.

turns.speaker: DEREK
turns.text: About what?

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: The forbidden subject.

turns.speaker: DEREK
turns.text: Lemme take you home.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: I'll get my jacket.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: This is exactly what I don't want.

turns.speaker: DEREK
turns.text: I think it's out of your control.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: My screwed up life shouldn't have to bleed onto my friends.

turns.speaker: DEREK
turns.text: Let us decide that.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: What about your film? Isn't it due next week? Have you even started it?

turns.speaker: DEREK
turns.text: It's under control.

turns.speaker: DEREK
turns.text: I had the four o'clock shift. You weren't there. You had us worried. Is everything okay?

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: No, it's not.

turns.speaker: DEREK
turns.text: I don't really know what happened in Woodsboro, Sid. But I know you don't trust me.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: It's not you, Derek. I don't trust myself. I tend to make big selection errors when it comes to men.

turns.speaker: DEREK
turns.text: Then I'll make this easy for you. I like you. I'm crazy about you, Sid. But I'm gonna stay away. Until you say otherwise.

turns.speaker: DEREK
turns.text: Go on, untie him.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: No. This is a set up.

turns.speaker: DEREK
turns.text: Thats quick.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: DEREK
turns.text: Good question. You took the bait.

turns.speaker: DEREK
turns.text: Poor Cotton, could life be a little more cruel?

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Youre not going to get away with this.

turns.speaker: DEREK
turns.text: Yeah, were trying to send a message to Hollywood. Im really getting tired of all the happy endings. Its just not reality. In the real world the good guys die, the innocent are punished, and the murderers inherit the earth.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: But nobody wants to see that. Itll never go. Theyll rewrite you. You dont want that.

turns.speaker: DEREK
turns.text: Two.

turns.speaker: HALLIE
turns.text: So you'll relieve me at 2:30...

turns.speaker: DEREK
turns.text: And watch her til 8:00--I've got to edit.

turns.speaker: DEREK
turns.text: Where's Sid?

turns.speaker: HALLIE
turns.text: Damned if I know. She ditched me.

turns.speaker: DEREK
turns.text: You weren't supposed to leave her alone.

turns.speaker: HALLIE
turns.text: I didn't say she was alone. That guy-- from her home town showed up. They went off together.

turns.speaker: HALLIE
turns.text: She's got guards with her.

turns.speaker: DEREK
turns.text: What guy?

turns.speaker: HALLIE
turns.text: Randy somebody.

turns.speaker: HALLIE
turns.text: He seemed harmless.

turns.speaker: DEREK
turns.text: Aren't most serial killers seemingly harmless?

turns.speaker: DEREK
turns.text: Need some help, honey.

turns.speaker: HALLIE
turns.text: I got it..

turns.speaker: HALLIE
turns.text: Yeah, you look quizzical yet pensive.

turns.speaker: DEREK
turns.text: Yeah, how can we help? Do you have any questions regarding the sequel of your life?

turns.speaker: HALLIE
turns.text: Ever see NATURAL BORN KILLERS? Well, Derek and I have this whole Mickey/Mallory-Woody Harrelson/Juliette Lewis thing going on.

turns.speaker: DEREK
turns.text: I really dont like that comparison, honey.

turns.speaker: HALLIE
turns.text: He hates Oliver Stone.

turns.speaker: DEREK
turns.text: I find his work overwrought.

turns.speaker: HALLIE
turns.text: He sent me the cutest e-mail.

turns.speaker: DEREK
turns.text: I read her postings on the horror movie chat boards and fell hopelessly. Hook, line...

turns.speaker: HALLIE
turns.text: We have our own website now. We dedicated a whole page to you.

turns.speaker: DEREK
turns.text: Youd me amazed at how many of us there are out there. Its a whole world, Sid. Youre really popular amongst the demented.

turns.speaker: HALLIE
turns.text: Youre the one who got away.

turns.speaker: DEREK
turns.text: Until now.

turns.speaker: HALLIE
turns.text: Of course not. Who wants to? Whats the point if we dont get caught? Wheres the glamour in that?

turns.speaker: DEREK
turns.text: The way I see it. Well be arrested. Go to prison. Cash in on the home footage. Secure a book deal. If all goes as planned, our trial should coincide with the release of STAB II.

turns.speaker: HALLIE
turns.text: A verdict and premiere all on the same day. I love it.

turns.speaker: DEREK
turns.text: Were hoping for the death penalty. I have this whole DEAD MAN WALKING swan song exit planned.

turns.speaker: HALLIE
turns.text: And now, drum roll please...

turns.speaker: DEREK
turns.text: Hope youre ready, Sid. We got one last surprise for you.

turns.speaker: HALLIE
turns.text: A twist ending if you will.

turns.speaker: DEREK
turns.text: Yeah, we really had our work cut out for us. It really is the curse of the sequel. The Billy/Stu things been done.

turns.speaker: HALLIE
turns.text: ..so we had to be different but yet the same because if you venture to far away from your orginal story you completely alienate the audience...

turns.speaker: DEREK
turns.text: And we didnt want to do that, Sid. We wanted to give you your moneys worth.

turns.speaker: HALLIE
turns.text: So we found a compromise.

turns.speaker: DEREK
turns.text: Or it found us.

turns.speaker: HALLIE
turns.text: We have a surprise guest star waiting in the wings.

turns.speaker: DEREK
turns.text: Just for you, Sid.

turns.speaker: HALLIE
turns.text: Wait a sec, Derek. We forgot to flip.

turns.speaker: DEREK
turns.text: Oh yeah.  We figure the one of us that actually kills you will get a little more press. Its been an ongoing discussion.  Heads or tails?

turns.speaker: HALLIE
turns.text: Tails.

turns.speaker: DEREK
turns.text: We had to have financing.

turns.speaker: HALLIE
turns.text: Tuitions expensive.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: Hello, Dwight.

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: Miss Weathers.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: I've been trying to reach you but you haven't returned...

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: I'm on crowd patrol, Miss Weathers, excuse me.

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: Yes, Miss Weathers, your name is embedded clearly between my ears.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: I see you read the book.

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: Yes, I do retain reading skills. Shock.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: And an explanation is, of course, out of the question.

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: Page 32. "Deputy Dewey filled the room with his dim-witted Barney Fifish presence." I think you've explained yourself.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: Oh Dewey, I'm sorry.

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: No, what you are is a money hungry, fame- seeking liar and--forgive me for saying-- mediocre writer who has a cold storage shed where her heart should be.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: You have every right to be upset.

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: Page 41. "Deputy Dewey oozed with inexperience."

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: I never meant to imply...

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: How do you know my dim-witted inexperience isn't merely a subtle form of manipulation used to lower people's expectations thereby enhancing my ability to effectively maneuver within any given situation?

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: I'm sorry. I don't know what else to say except I'm sorry.

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: No, I'm the one who's sorry. I misjudged you. Now if you'll excuse me, I have some oozing to do.

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: So what made you change your mind about Sidney?

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: Mood swing. I'm manic depressive.

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: You're a hard one to figure out. GALE It's that complex yet shallow quality. It's deliberate.

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: I think you're all an act.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: And deep down I'm a good person? Make no mistake, Dewey, I'm a shit.

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: I know that.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: Yeah?

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: I also know that you're an aging TV reporter slash writer who, despite huge tabloid success, has some self worth issues regarding your personal life which directly effects your professional life in a non-positive manner. A coupla failed relationships with--I'm guessing balding, older men--have turned you into this bitch with a cell phone. But I bet sometimes, late at night, when you're all alone a sadness seeps to the surface and in a moment of clarity you know that all you really want is to be touched and held and fondled.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: Not good. How you doin?

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: Not good.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: If you were truly a copycat, wouldn't you want to emulate everything about the killer that you could?

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: Meaning?

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: He's already gotta be a part of Sid's life. What do you know about this Derek?

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: Solid alibis. He was with Sidney when she was attacked.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: Billy had alibis too.

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: You broke my heart.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: What are we looking for?

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: A bloody knife. A ghost mask. Something like that?

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: Can we turn the light on?

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: That's not the way it's done.

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: And it's sexier in the dark.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: Dewey, you and I would never make it.

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: Maybe not. But think about the sex. As frustrated as I am...

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: ..and as lonely as I am...

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: We'd break some furniture.

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: They're roomates.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: And Joel's pre-med.

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: The sorority girl was gutted with autopsy precision.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: Shit! It's both of them. The first murders were to throw us - using the same names as Woodsboro. But they've moved on- -they're getting closer to Sidney. They're not looking for a Himbry or a Tatum to kill. They're looking for the new Tatum.

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: Hallie?

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: Ssshh! What was that?

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: Let's find out.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: This is all too familiar.

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: Over here.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: Maybe they never got here. He could have taken her anywhere.

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: C'mon. Let's go.

turns.speaker: GALE
turns.text: Jesus Christ!

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: He filmed his victims.
